Starting underneath the chassis of this

175.text:

The next test is to see it driving along

208.text:
It is possible to set the steering

212.text:
and he we are setting crab steering so the

216.text:
But again axle 2 is stepping out of

220.text:
Let's try again with conventional
steering but again axle 2 is not happy,

224.text:
although of course on the display shelf

228.text:

The pads are lowered in the normal way by

244.text:
Also included with the model are
some nice spreader plates.

248.text:
With the outriggers down and mounted on

255.text: Pardon me, I've now got my boom up,

To alter the boom angle you use the specially

Then you can set the boom at any angle

318.text:
So there we had the crane performing a

321.text:
and now let's move on to the genuine

325.text:
And here we have the crane set up ready
for some load testing.

329.text: The crane has been set up with the Y-guy extension and a 33 metre boom,

333.text: and is lifting at a radius of 40cm which scales up to 20 metres.

338.text:
So looking at the low chart in a TY
configuration at twenty metres

342.text: the crane can lift about forty tonnes.

345.text:
The first load on the scales is just
under 0.5Kg,

349.text:
and if we scale down the load of forty
tonnes by dividing by 50 by 50 by 50

356.text:
so this first load we are putting on already
represents a 50 percent

362.text:
The crane takes the strain and the boom bends a
little but is able to hold the scale 60 tonne

370.text:
Let's now add some more weights on and these are
heavy counterweight pieces from another

375.text:
and with the first part on the crane is
still holding it

380.text: and there are not too many creeks and groans.

383.text:
Of course if we're being very accurate we
should also take into account the load

389.text:
but hey this is Cranes Etc - near
enough is good enough!

393.text:
We have just now added the last parts of the
counterweight on

397.text:
and the crane feels like it's just about
on the point of tipping,

401.text:
so that the total load represents the
tipping load for the crane.

405.text:
Let's put that load on the scales and we
see it is nearly 1 kilogram

409.text:
so the tipping note is three times the
rated load

412.text: and that's a very good result for our Liebherr LTM 1350.

423.text:
This is another very nice version of
Liebherr's 350 tonne mobile crane,

428.text:
and is a very attractive model in the
colours of Felbermayr.

431.text:
On the whole the functionality is very
good,

434.text:
it looks very realistic and it has some
great detailing.

438.text:
So overall it's no surprise this is
another outstanding crane model.
